content: baby fan mitts design by morgan wolf lace mitts in light weight yarn are perfectly warming and charming in over-chilled offices or anytime your hands need a little warmth and comfort with plenty of dexterity they are knit in the round with a full thumb gusset for comfort measurements the gloves measure 6 5 inches 16 cm around and 6 5 inches 16 cm from cuff to top thanks to the stretchiness of the lace they are comfortable for hands up to 8 inches so they fit women s size medium to large adjustments to size can be made by adjusting yarn and needle size the gloves can also easily be modified to have longer cuffs just knit more before starting the thumb gusset stitch pattern baby fan is a lovely and stretchy lace that is one of many versions of feather and fan the stitch is from the complete book of knitting by barbara abbey 1971 a great beginner s lace it has just one pattern row followed by three row of plain knitting the feather and fan pattern is great for beginners because it has only one decrease k2tog and all the yarn overs are between knit stitches however if you enjoy symmetry consider doing a modification of the lace pattern throughout the mitt k2tog k2tog yo k yo k yo k yo ssk ssk e wedaimonia etsy com page 1 baby fan mitts the lace pattern results in a scalloped cuff and a wavy top line there are two options for finishing if you crochet crochet edges work nicely decorative and functional they add some body to the edges and prevent rolling alternatively instructions for garter stitch edges are included materials 50 grams or 150 yards of dk weight yarn 11 wraps per inch the pink sample gloves were done with reynolds soft sea wool reynolds soft sea wool is tightly-plied 2-ply dk-weight 100 percent wool that is soft and springy it is put up in 50 gram skeins with 162 yards per skein the pink gloves used just 35 grams or about 115 yards of yarn needles etc size 3 us 3 25 mm double pointed needles or whatever size needed for gauge or use your favorite circular needles magic loop or two circulars e wedaimonia etsy com page 2 baby fan mitts tapestry needle for weaving in the ends for the crochet finish option a crochet hook in size b 2 25 mm gauge to get the size medium large 6 5 inch or 16 cm mitt gauge is 27 stitches and 36 row per four inches 10 cm of baby fan pattern knit in the round knitting a swatch in the round with at least three pattern repeats 33 stitches is recommended this gives you a chance to learn the pattern and ensure that your cast on edge is sufficiently stretchy be sure to wash block and dry the
